job_title: Resourcing & Talent Advisor in Walton-on-Thames, England
pros: Friendly atmosphere, beautiful surroundings, great career development opportunities
cons: Public transport (bus) links not very frequent

pros: I never in the last 12 years have not wanted to come to work, Teams are respectful and work together to ensure the best care for the Resident and Villagers. Truly a lovely place to work
cons: Travel time varies and depends on the M25, You need to drive or ride a bike

pros: Colleagues were good so was the pay

review_title: A good place to work with nice people
pros: Great teamwork, managers and leaders are mostly very good to work for because they listen to you and seem to really care.
cons: Lack of permanent staff because it's difficult to recruit

review_title: Amazing working environment, fabulous people doing a great job
reviewer_affiliation: Current Temporary Employee, less than 1 year
pros: The people are just lovely here, the grounds are beautiful and they all have the same goal, to look after elderly people well and with compassion and respect.
cons: I enjoyed every moment working here, it's a very special place.

job_title: Director of Care in Lancing, England
pros: Excellent purpose, colleagues and support. Genuinely caring charity, both about its staff and residents.
cons: Hard work and tough working in social care.
